content: pumpkins by sarah-margaret these little sweeties can be knit in any thickness of yarn i have done them in sport weight dk worsted and bulky if you want to work with fingering weight i would suggest holding it double and work with the needle size suggested for worsted weight the pattern is written for working with double pointed needles but could be modified to use magic loop there are two size options small or large the small pumpkin has 36 stitches at its widest point and the large pumpkin has 48 stitches the numbers in brackets at the end of the round instructions are updated stitch counts after working increase or decrease rounds needle size suggestions sport 3 25mm dk 3 5mm worsted 3 75mm bulky 4 5mm materials small amount of yarn in desired size- 10-20g for main colour even less yarn for the stem colour darning needle locking stitch marker a little bit of polyfill terms bor beginning of round place a locking marker in the fabric to mark the beginning of the round stitches with the working yarn coming from the left end stitch do not turn put the needle with the stitches on it into the left hand and slide the stitches to the right repeat working the stitches with the yarn coming from the left end stitch k knit kfb knit front and back work all the steps of a regular knit stitch up to sliding the stitch off the left- hand needle before dropping that stitch
